meanings.definition: To remove the permission or authorization from something.
meanings.sent1: I had to deperm the old password to set a new one.
meanings.sent2: The security guard had to deperm the visitor's access card.
meanings.sent3: The magician depermed the rabbit's ability to disappear!
meanings.sent4: The storm depermed the town's power supply, leaving everyone in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher depermed the students' freedom to use their phones during class.

meanings.definition: The act of taking away the ability to enter or access a certain area.
meanings.sent1: The deperm of the key made it impossible to unlock the door.
meanings.sent2: The deperm of the gate prevented anyone from entering the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The deperm of the treasure chest kept the pirates from their loot!
meanings.sent4: The deperm of the bridge blocked the path across the river.
meanings.sent5: The deperm of the elevator trapped us on the ground floor.

meanings.definition: The process of revoking someone's right to do something.
meanings.sent1: The deperm of his driver's license meant he couldn't drive anymore.
meanings.sent2: The deperm of her library card restricted her from borrowing books.
meanings.sent3: The deperm of his gym membership left him without access to the facilities.
meanings.sent4: The deperm of their internet connection limited their online activities.
meanings.sent5: The deperm of his passport prevented him from traveling abroad.
